detaileddescription.para: Trigger a software reset of the Pozyx device. Function that will trigger the reset of the system. This will reload all configurations from flash memory, or to their default values.

parameterdescription.para: optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used.

detaileddescription.para: Function for turning the leds on and off. This function allows you to turn one of the 4 LEDs on the Pozyx board on or off. By default, the LEDs are controlled by the Pozyx system to give status information. This can be changed using the function setLedConfig.

parameterdescription.para: the led number to be controlled, value between 1, 2, 3 or 4.
the state to set the selected led to. Can be 0 (led is off) or 1 (led is on)
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used
success.
function failed.
function timed out, no response received.

detaileddescription.para: Function to obtain the interrupt configuration. This functions obtains the interrupt mask from the register reg:POZYX_INT_MASK. The interrupt mask is used to determine which event trigger an interrupt.

parameterdescription.para: the configured interrupt mask
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used
success.
function failed.
function timed out, no response received.

detaileddescription.para: Function to configure the interrupts. Function to configure the interrupts by means of the interrupt mask from the register reg:POZYX_INT_MASK. The interrupt mask is used to determine which event trigger an interrupt.

parameterdescription.para: reference to the interrupt mask to be written. Bit-wise combinations of the following flags are allowed: POZYX_INT_MASK_ERR, POZYX_INT_MASK_POS, POZYX_INT_MASK_IMU, POZYX_INT_MASK_RX_DATA, POZYX_INT_MASK_FUNC.
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used
success.
function failed.
function timed out, no response received.

detaileddescription.para: Obtain the pull configuration of a GPIO pin. Function to obtain the configured pin mode of the GPIO for the given pin number. This is performed by reading from the reg:POZYX_CONFIG_GPIO1 up to reg:POZYX_CONFIG_GPIO4 register.

parameterdescription.para: the pin to update
pointer to the mode of GPIO. Possible values POZYX_GPIO_DIGITAL_INPUT, POZYX_GPIO_PUSHPULL, POZYX_GPIO_OPENDRAIN
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used.

memberdef.name: setConfigGPIO

detaileddescription.para: Configure the GPIOs. Function to set the configuration mode of the GPIO for the given pin number. This is performed by writing to the reg:POZYX_CONFIG_GPIO1 up to reg:POZYX_CONFIG_GPIO4 register.

parameterdescription.para: the GPIO pin to update. Possible values are 1, 2, 3 or 4.
the mode of GPIO. Possible values POZYX_GPIO_DIGITAL_INPUT, POZYX_GPIO_PUSHPULL, POZYX_GPIO_OPENDRAIN
pull configuration of GPIO. Possible values are POZYX_GPIO_NOPULL, POZYX_GPIO_PULLUP, POZYX_GPIO_PULLDOWN.
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used
success.

detaileddescription.para: Configure the LEDs. This function configures the 6 LEDs on the pozyx device by writing to the register reg:POZYX_LED_CTRL. More specifically, the function configures which LEDs give system information. By default all the LEDs will give system information.

parameterdescription.para: default: the configuration to be set. See POZYX_LED_CTRL for details.
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used.
success.

memberdef.argsstring: (int type, uint8_t registers[]=NULL, int num_registers=0, uint16_t remote_id=NULL)
memberdef.name: saveConfiguration

detaileddescription.para:
Save (part of) the configuration to Flash memory.
Requires firmware version v1.0 This functions stores (parts of) the configurable Pozyx settings in the non-volatile flash memory of the Pozyx device. This function will save the current settings and on the next startup of the Pozyx device these saved settings will be loaded automatically. settings from the flash memory. All registers that are writable, the anchor ids for positioning and the device list (which contains the anchor coordinates) can be saved.

parameterdescription.para: this specifies what should be saved. Possible options are POZYX_FLASH_REGS, POZYX_FLASH_ANCHOR_IDS or POZYX_FLASH_NETWORK.
an option array that holds all the register addresses for which the value must be saved. All registers that are writable are allowed.
optional parameter that determines the length of the registers array.
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used.
success.
function failed.
function timed out.

detaileddescription.para:
Save registers to the flash memory. See saveConfiguration for more information
Requires firmware version v1.0
registers
an option array that holds all the register addresses for which the value must be saved. All registers that are writable are allowed.
num_registers
optional parameter that determines the length of the registers array.
remote_id
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used.
POZYX_SUCCESS
success.
#POZYX_FAIL
function failed.
POZYX_TIMEOUT
function timed out.

clearConfiguration

Clears the configuration.
Requires firmware version v1.0 This function clears (part of) the configuration that was previously stored in the non-volatile Flash memory. The next startup of the Pozyx device will load the default configuration values for the registers, anchor_ids and network list.

parameterdescription.para: optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used.
success.
function failed.

detaileddescription.para:
Verify if a register content is saved in the flash memory.
Requires firmware version v1.0 This function verifies if a given register variable, specified by its address, is saved in flash memory.
regAddress
the register address to check
remote_id
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used.
true(1)
if the register variable is saved
false(0)
if the register variable is not saved
Return the number of register variables saved in flash memory.

parameterdescription.para: optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used.

simplesect.para: the number of register variables saved in flash memory.
